The nearest major airport to Kulmbach is in Nürnberg. The nearest airfield is Kulmbacher Flugplatz
Kulmbach is easily accessible on the autobahn A70, approximately 90 km north of
There are two main breweries in Kulmbach, the small Kommunbrau Brewery
and the big Kulmbacher Brauerei with the Bavarian Brewery Museum

(Kulmbach Beer Festival) begins on the last Saturday in July and continues through until the first weekend in August. Be advised that getting accommodation might be a bit difficult at the time of the Bierfest. But not impossible, if you're early enough with for reservations.

The Alstadtfest (Old Town Festival) takes place on the first weekend in July and is organised by the restaurants, bars and pubs in the old part of the town.

Every other year Kulmbach hosts one of the world's largest model figure shows, Internationale Zinnfigurenbörse (this year 9–11 August 2013). Thousands of miniatures from exhibitors and retailers from around the world are on sale and display. Also visit the German Museum of Miniatures located inside the Castle Plassenburg. Founded in 1929, the museum has more than 300,000 individual pieces.
The Farmers Market, in front of the Town hall, takes place every Wednesday and Saturday 7h-12h and sells fresh fruit, vegetables, meat, sausages and flowers.
Best of Kulmbach are fried sausages (Bratwurst) and beer.

content=Restaurant of the biggest brewery, near Brewery museum, with the largest beer garden in town. Try the museum beer

, is a dark, tasty beer speciality with 9%  alcoholic content.

value: content= The last brewpub in Kulmbach, founded in 1994 as brewing cooperative . A small group of townspeople decided to open small brewery where they could make traditional, unfiltered beer. They offering a light “Hell” and a dark beer “Bernstein” and every month a special beer. The first taste of the new brew is every first Wednesday in month. It’s in a nice location, the building is an old water mill, but it’s the in-house brewery that sets it apart.
content= Oldest pub in town, interior furnishing from 1938.
